In the latest episode of the Strategerist #podcast, we speak with @RodaWorld_ author of the critically acclaimed children’s storybook Mae Among the Stars, about how important representation is in children’s literature. Listen here: 

@HarperChildrens https://t.co/QA5dOih9Wx

Check out "Trade as a Pathway to Peace", an essay by Hiroki Takeuchi, Director of the Sun and Star Program on Japan and East Asia at @SMUTowerCenter for Public Policy and International Affairs in "The #China Dilemma" edition of The Catalyst. #CatalystIdeas https://t.co/HrKMmyjhYn

On Wednesday, Chinese authorities sentenced Hong Kong democracy activist @joshuawongcf to 13-and-a-half months in prison. Read more from the Bush Institute’s @Bill_McKenzie, @WLindsayLloyd and @ChrisJamesWalsh: https://t.co/KuFvywcb7x

How should America respond to growing challenges from China? 

"The China Dilemma" issue of The Catalyst presents the problem and offers both short-term and long- term solutions. Check it out: https://t.co/fy6dL2pQcZ

"School boards, parents, and policymakers all want the same outcome: healthy, well-prepared, well-adjusted children in our community." Read more from CEO of @brightbeamntwk @citizenstewart: https://t.co/MhNLrgVenk

Baby boomers are handing successor generations a toolkit, in particular a scaffolding of international cooperation that is well suited to tackle this century's challenges.
